article:
'Muhammadu Kudu Abubakar Ubandoma III' was appointed Etsu (Ruler) of the Agaie
Emirate, a traditional state based in Agaie in Niger State, Nigeria on 30 April
2004. {{cite web
|url=http://www.thisdayonline.com/archive/2004/05/01/20040501news19.html
|work=This Day |date=2004-05-01 |title=Kure Names New Emir of Agaie |author=Jide
Orintunsin |accessdate=2010-09-11}}

Abubakar, who was 42 when appointed Emir, is the son of the 10th Emir of Agaie,
Alhaji Abdullahi Bello Ubandoma. He earned a Higher Diploma in Animal Health and
Husbandry and a Postgraduate Diploma in Public Administration from Ahmadu Bello
University, Zaria. He is grand patron of the Nuhu Lafarma
(Education) Foundation, which promotes improved education in the Agaie
Emriate. {{cite web |url=http://lafarmafoundationagaie.com/aboutus.html
|publisher=Nuhu Lafarma (Education) Foundation |title=THE FOUNDATION |accessdate=2010-09-
11}} He is one of the promoters of formation of a new Edu State from parts
of the current Niger and Kwara states as a homeland for the Nupe people, with
capital at Bida. The movement is led by the Emir of Bida, Abubakar Yahaya, and
is also supported by the Etsu Lapai, Umar Baogo III. {{cite web |url=http:/-
/www.compassnewspaper.com/~compas/NG/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&-
id=22684:bankole-endorses-call-for-creation-of-edu-state-from-niger-
kwara&Itemid=7966 |title=Bankole endorses call for creation of Edu State from
Niger, Kwara |date=16 JULY 2009 |author=HOPE AFOKE ORIVRI |work=Nigerian Compass
|accessdate=2010-09-11}}

In January 2010 Abubakar conferred the honorary title of "Badakoshin Agaie" on
the Niger State governor Muazu Babangida Aliyu. {{cite web
|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201001120514.html |title=Governor Aliyu Warns
Traditional Rulers Against Partisan Politics |work=Vanguard |author=Wole
Mosadomi |date=12 January 2010 |accessdate=2010-09-11}} In July 2010 he
was attacked in Agaie by an angry mob who accused him of siding with the police
after local people had tried to prevent police from pursuing suspected
criminals. In the ensuing violence one person was killed, and later the mob
carried his body to the Etsu's palace. {{cite web |url=http://peoplesdaily-
online.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=9868:mob-attacks-emir-
of-agaie-for-siding-with-the-police&catid=16:national-news&Itemid=33 |title==Mob
attacks Emir of Agaie for siding with the Police |date=21 July 2010
|author=Aideloje Ojo, |work=Peoples Daily |accessdate=2010-09-11}}
